alert.note: Alert for Bannock; Bear Lake; Bingham; Blaine; Bonneville; Butte; Caribou; Cassia; Clark; Custer; Franklin; Fremont; Jefferson; Lincoln; Madison; Minidoka; Oneida; Power; Teton (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 10 at 2:26PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WARMING TEMPERATURES WILL RESULT IN INCREASED SNOW MELT AND POTENTIAL FLOODING... Warming temperatures will accelerate the melting of snowpack through mid-week. Daytime highs today and Tuesday will reach into the mid 50s in mountain valleys and the upper 60s to low 70s across the eastern Magic Valley, Raft River region, and lower Snake Plain. It is important to note that most of the CWA will remain above freezing tonight. These extended periods of above freezing temperatures could exacerbate runoff from melting. While most of the flooding potential will be a result of runoff in low-lying locations, snowmelt in the foothill areas will also increase flow on small creeks and streams including some larger streams that feed into mainstem rivers. Melting snow has already led to flooding in portions of Jefferson County and Bonneville Counties where a flood advisory has been issued due to observed sheet flooding impacting homes and roads. Mainstem river responses will lag the warmest temps and will approach action stage at the Portneuf River at Topaz and Pocatello, and the Bear River at the ID/UT border Wed and Thu. Clear snow, ice and debris from culverts and other flow paths to allow runoff to flow away from buildings and other vulnerable infrastructure. Move deep snow away from the foundations of buildings and move equipment, and livestock out of poorly drained or low lying areas. Remember, if you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around don`t drown, you never know what road conditions are hidden under the water.
